<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" SIZE="2">
<A NAME="eolPage54"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	ITEM 9: &nbsp;&nbsp;AUDIT COMMITTEE INFORMATION
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The Audit Committee&#146;s Charter
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The text of the Audit Committee&#146;s charter is attached to this AIF as Schedule &#147;A&#148;.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Composition of the Audit Committee
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The members of the Audit Committee are as follows: John A. Clarke, Piers A.
	Cumberlege and Bernard R. van Rooyen. Each such member is
	&#147;independent&#148; within the meaning of National Instrument 52-110 -
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Audit Committees
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(&#147;
</FONT>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	NI 52-110
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#148;). Each
	such member is also &#147;financially literate&#148; within the meaning of NI
	52-110.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Relevant Education and Experience of Audit Committee Members
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The following is a description of the education and experience of each Audit
	Committee member that is relevant to the performance of his responsibilities as
	an Audit Committee member:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<U>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	John A. Clarke
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	From 1997 to August 2008, Mr.&nbsp;Clarke was the President and Chief Executive
	Officer of Nevsun Resources Ltd., a mineral exploration and development company
	which is listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange and the NYSE Amex.
	He is currently Vice Chairman of Nevsun
	Resources Ltd.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	From 1988 to 1993, Mr.&nbsp;Clarke was with Ashanti Goldfields Company Limited (&#147;
</FONT>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Ashanti
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#148;) engaged as a General Manager in a range of roles, including strategic planning, mine production and the technical/administrative support of mining operations. From 1993 to 1997, Mr.&nbsp;Clarke was an Executive Director of Ashanti and was in charge of business development, including company strategic planning, Africa-wide exploration programs, and the acquisition of listed companies. His roles with Ashanti required experience and understanding of all of the issues required in assessing/analyzing and preparing technical and financial plans and statements for mining and exploration operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Mr.&nbsp;Clarke holds a Masters of Business Administration from Middlesex Polytechnic (now Middlesex University). This degree included in-depth courses in accounting principles, standards and practices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<U>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Piers A. Cumberlege
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In addition to his current consultancy and his investment responsibilities at
	Cordiant Capital Inc.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	from April 2005 to October
	2008
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, Mr.&nbsp;Cumberlege has worked at Hawker Siddeley,
	BTR, GEC-Marconi and Delta Capital in emerging market project finance, corporate
	acquisition and private equity investment roles since 1983. In these roles he
	has been actively engaged in analyzing financial statements of investment
	prospects, as well as the regular financial monitoring and reporting of
	portfolio companies. He also has experience of restatement across different
	national and international accounting standards and introducing IAS and GAAP
	reporting procedures into companies that have been operating to other local
	standards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Mr. Cumberlege served on the audit committee of Sun-Interbrew Limited (a
	Frankfurt-listed company) between June 1999 and October 2001. He holds a Diploma
	in Business Administration from Coventry University and the ICD.D qualification
	from the Canadian Institute of Corporate Directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="54%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="89%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN;LINE-HEIGHT:108%'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN;LINE-HEIGHT:108%'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	41
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<BR>
<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" SIZE="2">
<A NAME="eolPage55"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<U>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Bernard R. van Rooyen
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	From 1980 to 1990, Mr.&nbsp;van Rooyen was Executive Director, Corporate Finance and Non-Technical Services to Gold Fields of South Africa Limited, an international mining company listed in Johannesburg, New York, London and various European Exchanges. He was responsible for, among other things, the entire financial system from financial accounts through management accounts, cost control and management information to the treasury.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	From 1998 to 2005, Mr.&nbsp;van Rooyen served as a non-executive director on the audit committee of Gold Fields Limited, an international gold producer with a market capitalization of approximately US$10 billion and the successor to Gold Fields of South Africa Limited. Gold Fields Limited is listed in Johannesburg, New York, London and Frankfurt.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Mr.&nbsp;van Rooyen is currently a non-executive member of the audit committee of Trans Hex Group, a producer and marketer of diamonds listed on the JSE Securities Exchange.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Mr.&nbsp;van Rooyen was President of the Company from November 1996 to January 2001.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Reliance on Certain Exemptions
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	At no time since the commencement of the year ended December 31, 2008 has the
	Company relied on an exemption in section 2.4 of NI 52-110 (
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	De Minimis Non-audit Services
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	), section 3.2 of NI
	52-110 (
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Initial Public Offerings
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	), section 3.3(2) of NI 52-110 (
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Controlled
	Companies
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	), section 3.4 of NI 52-110 (
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Events Outside Control of Member
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	), section 3.5 of
	NI 52-110 (
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Death, Disability or Resignation of Audit
	Committee Member
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) or section 3.6 of NI 52-110
	(
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Temporary Exemption for Limited and Exceptional
</FONT>
</I>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Circumstances
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	), on an exemption from NI 52-110, in whole or in part, granted under Part 8 of NI 52-110 (
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Exemptions
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) or on section 3.8 of NI 52-110 (
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Acquisition of Financial Literacy
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Audit Committee Oversight
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	At no time since the commencement of the Company&#146;s financial year ended December 31, 2008 was a recommendation of the Audit Committee to nominate or compensate an external auditor not adopted by the board of directors of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Pre-Approval Policies and Procedures
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The Audit Committee has not adopted specific policies or procedures for the engagement of non-audit services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	External Auditors Service Fees
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The following summarizes (a) the estimated total fees of BDO Dunwoody
</FONT>
<SMALL>
	LLP
</SMALL>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the external auditors of the Company, for the financial year of the Company ended December 31, 2008 (these fees are estimates as, as at the date of this AIF, these fees had not yet been billed), and (b) the total fees billed by BDO Dunwoody
</FONT>
<SMALL>
	LLP
</SMALL>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	for the financial year of the Company ended December 30, 2007:
</FONT>

<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION_4"></A>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	ITEM 12: &nbsp;&nbsp;INTEREST OF MANAGEMENT AND OTHERS IN MATERIAL TRANSACTIONS
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Other than as described below or elsewhere in this AIF, no director or officer of the Company or person
	or company that beneficially owns, or controls or directs, directly or
	indirectly, more than 10% of the outstanding common shares of the Company, or
	any of their respective associates or affiliates, had or has any material
	interest, directly or indirectly, in any transaction within the three most
	recently completed financial years or during the current financial year that has
	materially affected or is reasonably expected to materially affect the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>

	(the &#147;
</FONT>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	CGII Accounts
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#148;)
	managed by affiliates of Capital Group International, Inc. hold, in the
	aggregate, more than 10% of the outstanding common shares of the Company, and
	(b) institutional accounts (the &#147;
</FONT>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Tradewinds
	Accounts
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#148;) managed by affiliates of Tradewinds
	Global Investors, LLC hold, in the aggregate, more than 10% of the outstanding
	common shares of the Company.
</FONT>

<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" SIZE="2">
<A NAME="eolPage57"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In May 2006, the Company completed an equity financing which involved (including
	the exercise by the underwriters of an over-allotment option) the issue and sale
	of a total of 4,376,000 common shares of the Company at a price of Cdn$12.80 per
	share for total gross proceeds of Cdn$56,012,800. The Company understands that
	CGII Accounts purchased shares under this financing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In September 2008, the Company completed an equity financing which involved
	(including the exercise by the underwriters of an over-allotment option) the
	issue and sale of a total of 12,000,000 units of the Company at a price of
	US$1.75 per unit for total gross proceeds of US$21,000,000, with each such unit
	consisting of one common share of the Company and one-half of one Warrant
	(with each whole Warrant entitling the holder to purchase one common
	share of the Company at a price of US$2.20 until September 17, 2011). The
	Company understands that CGII Accounts and Tradewinds Accounts purchased shares
	under this financing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In February 2009, the Company completed an equity financing which involved the issue and sale of a total of 10,000,000 common shares of the Company at a price of US$1.40 per share for total gross proceeds of US$14,000,000. The Company understands that CGII Accounts and Tradewinds Accounts purchased shares under this financing.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;'>

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Terms of Reference
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Audit Committee of the Board of Directors
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Banro Corporation
</FONT>
</P>
<BR>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID 1.5PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:1;PADDING-TOP:0;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	November 23, 2004
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<U>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Mandate
</FONT>
</B>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" NOWRAP VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	A.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<U>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Role and Objectives
</FONT>
</B>
</U>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The Audit Committee (the "Committee") is a committee of the Board of Directors (the "Board") of Banro Corporation ("Banro") established for the purpose of overseeing the accounting and financial reporting process of Banro and external audits of the consolidated financial statements of Banro. In connection therewith, the Committee assists the Board in fulfilling its oversight responsibilities in relation to Banro's internal accounting standards and practices, financial information, accounting systems and procedures, financial reporting and statements and the nature and scope of the annual external audit. The Committee also recommends for Board approval Banro&#146;s audited annual consolidated financial statements and other mandatory financial disclosure.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Banro&#146;s external auditor is accountable to the Board and the Committee as representatives of shareholders of Banro. The Committee shall be directly responsible for overseeing the relationship of the external auditor. The Committee shall have such access to the external auditor as it considers necessary or desirable in order to perform its duties and responsibilities. The external auditor shall report directly to the Committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The objectives of the Committee are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN; '>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	1.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	to be satisfied with the credibility and integrity of financial reports;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN; '>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	to support the Board in meeting its oversight responsibilities in respect of the preparation and disclosure of financial reporting, including the consolidated financial statements of Banro;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN=TOP>

<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	3.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	to facilitate communication between the Board and the external auditor and to receive all reports of the external auditor directly from the external auditor;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>

</FONT>

</TD>

	4.

</P>
</TD>

</FONT>

<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>

</TD>

	5.

</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	to strengthen the role of independent directors by facilitating in-depth discussions between members of the Committee, management and Banro&#146;s external auditor.

	Composition

</B>
</U>
</P>

<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	1.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The Committee shall comprise at least 3 directors, none of whom shall be an officer or employee of Banro or any of its subsidiaries or any affiliate thereof. Each Committee member shall satisfy the independence, financial literacy and experience requirements of applicable securities laws, rules or guidelines, any applicable stock exchange requirements or guidelines and any other applicable regulatory rules. In particular, each member of the Committee shall have no direct or indirect material relationship with Banro or any affiliate thereof which could reasonably interfere with the exercise of the member's independent judgment. Determinations as to whether a particular director satisfies the requirements for membership on the Committee shall be made by the full Board.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN; '>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Members of the Committee shall be appointed by the Board. Each member shall serve until his successor is appointed, unless he shall resign or be removed by the Board or he shall otherwise cease to be a director of Banro.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN; '>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	3.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The Chair of the Committee may be designated by the Board or, if it does not do so, the members of the Committee may elect a Chair by vote of a majority of the full Committee membership. The Committee Chair shall satisfy the independence, financial literacy and experience requirements (as described above).
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN; '>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	4.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The Committee shall have access to such officers and employees of Banro and to such information respecting Banro as it considers to be necessary or advisable in order to perform its duties and responsibilities.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" NOWRAP VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	C.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<U>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Meetings
</FONT>
</B>
</U>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN; '>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	1.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	At all meetings of the Committee, every question shall be decided by a majority of the votes cast. In case of an equality of votes, the matter will be referred to the Board for decision.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN; '>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	A quorum for meetings of the Committee shall be a majority of its members.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15.38%; TEXT-INDENT:-7.69%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN; '>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	3.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Meetings of the Committee shall be scheduled at least quarterly and at such other times during each year as it deems appropriate. Minutes of all meetings of the Committee shall be taken. The Chief Financial Officer shall attend meetings of the Committee, unless otherwise excused from all or part of any such meeting by the Committee Chair. The Chair of the Committee shall hold
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	in camera
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	sessions of the Committee, without management present, at every meeting.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15.38%; TEXT-INDENT:-7.69%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN; '>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	4.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The Committee shall report the results of meetings and reviews undertaken and any associated recommendations to the Board.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15.38%; TEXT-INDENT:-7.69%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN; '>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	5.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The Committee shall meet periodically with Banro&#146;s external auditor (in connection with the preparation of the annual consolidated financial statements and otherwise as the Committee may determine), part or all of each such meeting to be in the absence of management.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15.38%; TEXT-INDENT:-7.69%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF" SIZE=2>
	A-2
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<BR>
<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" SIZE="2">
<A NAME="eolPage61"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<U>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Responsibilities
</FONT>
</B>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	As discussed above, the Committee is established to assist the Board in fulfilling its oversight responsibilities with respect to the accounting and financial reporting processes of Banro and external audits of Banro&#146;s consolidated financial statements. In that regard, the Committee shall:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN; '>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	1.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	satisfy itself on behalf of the Board with respect to Banro's internal control systems including identifying, monitoring and mitigating business risks as well as compliance with legal, ethical and regulatory requirements. The Committee shall also review with management, the external auditor and, if necessary, legal counsel, any litigation, claim or other contingency (including tax assessments) that could have a material effect on the financial position or operating results of Banro (on a consolidated basis), and the manner in which these matters may be, or have been, disclosed in the financial statements;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15.38%; TEXT-INDENT:-7.69%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN; '>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	review with management and the external auditor the annual consolidated financial statements of Banro, the reports of the external auditor thereon and related financial reporting, including Management's Discussion and Analysis and any earnings press releases, (collectively, "Annual Financial Disclosure") prior to their submission to the Board for approval. This process should include, but not be limited to:
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15.38%; TEXT-INDENT:-7.69%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN; '>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(a)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	reviewing changes in accounting principles, or in their application, which may have a material impact on the current or future year's financial statements;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15.38%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN; '>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(b)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	reviewing significant accruals, reserves or other estimates;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15.38%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN; '>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(c)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	reviewing accounting treatment of unusual or non-recurring transactions;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15.38%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN; '>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(d)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	reviewing adequacy of reclamation fund;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15.38%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN; '>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(e)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	reviewing disclosure requirements for commitments and contingencies;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15.38%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN; '>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(f)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	reviewing financial statements and all items raised by the external auditor, whether or not included in the financial statements; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15.38%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN; '>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(g)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	reviewing unresolved differences between Banro and the external auditor.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15.38%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Following such review, the Committee shall recommend to the Board for approval all Annual Financial Disclosure;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN; '>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	3.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	review with management all interim consolidated financial statements of Banro and related financial reporting, including Management's Discussion and Analysis and any earnings press releases, (collectively "Quarterly Financial Disclosure") and, if thought fit, approve all Quarterly Financial Disclosure;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15.38%; TEXT-INDENT:-7.69%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>

<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	4.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	be satisfied that adequate procedures are in place for the review of Banro&#146;s public disclosure of financial information extracted or derived from Banro&#146;s financial statements, other than Annual Financial Disclosure or Quarterly
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

</FONT>

<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:14%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	relationships that may reasonably be thought to bear on the independence of the external auditor with respect to Banro;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:30.77%; TEXT-INDENT:-7.69%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>

	(ii)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	discussing with the external auditor any disclosed relationships or services that the external auditor believes may affect the objectivity and independence of the external auditor; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:30.77%; TEXT-INDENT:-7.69%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>

</TD>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	(iii)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>

	recommending that the Board take appropriate action in response to the external auditor's information to satisfy itself of the external auditor's independence;
</FONT>
</P>

</TABLE>

<!-- MARKER FORMAT-SHEET="PARA DEFAULT" FSL="DEFAULT" -->
<P ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF" SIZE=2>
	A-5
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<BR>
<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" SIZE="2">
<A NAME="eolPage64"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;'>
<U>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Schedule "B"
</FONT>
</B>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;'>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Reproduction of Summary from Namoya Technical Report
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;'>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(which report was prepared by SENET and has an effective date of August 17, 2007)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	"The Namoya Project consists of one exploitation permit covering an area of 174 square kilometres and is located approximately 225 kilometres southwest of the town of Bukavu in Maniema Province in the east of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (the "DRC") (Figures 1 to 3). Namoya Mining SARL, which is wholly owned by Banro Corporation ("Banro"), has a 100% interest in the said permit. The Namoya property comprises four separate deposits: Mwendamboko and Muviringu to the northwest, Kakula in the centre and Namoya Summit to the southeast (Figure 4).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The main host rock for the gold mineralization is a fine grained sericite schist with associated albite, quartz, chlorite and calcite. Quartz veins and quartz &#145;stockworks&#146; cross-cut the majority of the host sediments which have also been intruded by quartz-feldspar porphyry. The quartz systems and its associated sediments host the primary gold mineralization.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	This technical report summarizes the results of the most recent mineral resource update of the Namoya mineralization, as well as the recently completed preliminary economic assessment of the Namoya Project. This report is intended to comply with the requirements of National Instrument 43-101 (
</FONT>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	"NI 43-101
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	"), including Form 43-101F1.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The most recent mineral resource estimates for Namoya were completed in June 2007 following the completion of an additional 7,411.53 metres (36 drill holes) of drilling since the previous Namoya mineral resource determination in September 2006. These new mineral resource estimates have been incorporated into a preliminary assessment of the Namoya Project. As part of Banro's QA/QC procedures, internationally recognised standards, duplicates and blanks were inserted into the sample batches. A total of 1,861 relative density measurements were taken from drill core at the deposits to convert volumes into tonnages. The mineral resources were estimated from the current and previous core drilling programs as well as previous verified adit information.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The methodology employed in estimating the mineral resources utilised a 3-dimensional wireframe model of the mineralization interpreted with 0.5 - 1.0 g/t Au sample cut-off, defined first in plan and on cross sections at 20-40 meters interval. The ore body models were constrained within the wireframe with primary block dimensions of 10 meters in the strike and cross structure directions, and 5 meters in the vertical direction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Semi-variorums were constructed for each deposit using one metre sample composite of the gold values. Some structure was apparent in the along strike and down-dip directions, and a Krige interpolation algorithm was adopted for the estimates given in the Table below. The Inferred Mineral Resources generated for Muviringu employed the inverse distance weighting interpolation algorithm.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The recent topographic survey and in particular the updated pit survey at Mwendamboko have been used to deplete the models.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Ore classification was carried out using solid wireframes to flag blocks as indicated and inferred. The improved geological knowledge coupled with the increased data density, the continuity of the mineralization and the increase reliability of the database, have allowed mineral resources to be classified with higher confidence.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<BR>
<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" SIZE="2">
<A NAME="eolPage65"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	SRK Consulting (UK) Limited ("
</FONT>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	SRK
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	"), who undertook the initial data compilation in 1998 and followed it up with a valuation between 1999 and 2003, have reviewed the estimation method in respect of the Namoya Project and concur with the approach used by Banro.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The table below summarizes the current mineral resource estimates for Namoya using a 1.0 g/t Au block cut-off.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="83%" STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:43.1PT;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>

	Tonnage rounded to the nearest '000 and ounces rounded to the nearest '00.

	&nbsp;
</FONT>

</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The estimates for the Indicated Mineral Resources at Namoya compare to the previous (September 2006) estimates as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Current Estimates: 8.925 Mt at a mean grade of 3.27 g/t containing 29,200 kg gold.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Previous Estimates: 7.386 Mt at a mean grade of 2.91 g/t containing 21,489
</FONT>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	kg gold.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The increase in the metal content of the Indicated Resource in the current estimates relative to the previous estimates is a function of the increased data density and improved geological knowledge as a result of the additional drilling.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The current mineral resource estimates are encouraging in terms of the increase in the Indicated Resources, and gives a clear scope and direction to the Project.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	A preliminary assessment of the Namoya Project was completed in July 2007 and the results are summarized in this report. Pit optimizations and underground mining studies were undertaken on the Indicated and Inferred Mineral Resources from which mining schedules were estimated. Results from metallurgical testwork of the various ore types at Namoya were used to determine metallurgical recoveries and determine the gravity/Carbon-in-Leach (CIL) processing flow sheet. Infrastructural and site services were estimated for the Project together with hydroelectric and diesel power alternatives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	An economic model and financial analysis was undertaken based on the following assumptions:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The results of the preliminary assessment of the Namoya Project is encouraging and warrants the progression of the Namoya Project to the pre-feasibility study stage.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	It is recommended that the exploration programme at Namoya for the rest of 2007 should focus on the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=4>
<B>
	&#149;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Continue with regional exploration to define known mineralization as well as identify new targets.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7.85%; TEXT-INDENT:-7.85%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>

	&nbsp;

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" STYLE='BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE'>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=4>
<B>
	&#149;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP>
<P STYLE='MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Further define capital and operating costs and reduce contingency costs.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:7.85%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:0.31%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The budget for the Namoya Project for 2007 is US$5,543,877. A total of US$1,569,000 has been assigned to drilling which accounts for approximately 28% of the total budget. The actual expenditures incurred at Namoya during 2007 will be dependent on the exploration results achieved during 2007."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	***************************************
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Note that the mineral resource estimates set out in the above summary have been
	superceded by the updated mineral resource estimates released in March 2009 as
	set out in item 3.3.2 of this AIF.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<I>
<B>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Cautionary Statements
</FONT>
</B>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The preliminary assessment of Namoya is preliminary in nature and includes inferred mineral resources that are considered too speculative geologically to have the economic considerations applied to them that would enable them to be categorized as mineral reserves. There is no certainty that the conclusions reached in the preliminary assessment will be realized. Mineral resources that are not mineral reserves do not have demonstrated economic viability.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;'>

	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION_6"></A>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
	MANAGEMENT&rsquo;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
	FOR THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2008
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX; FONT-SIZE: 1PT" TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" SIZE="2" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE>
</DIV>
</EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="eolPage69"></A>
<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION_7"></A>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
<B>
	MANAGEMENT&rsquo;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
<B>
	FOR THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2008
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The following management&rsquo;s discussion and analysis
	(&ldquo;
<B>
	MD&amp;A
</B>
	&rdquo;), which is dated as of March 31, 2009, provides a
	review of the activities, results of operations and financial condition of Banro
	Corporation (the &ldquo;
<B>
	Company
</B>
	&rdquo;) as at and for the financial year
	of the Company ended December 31, 2008 (&ldquo;
<B>
	fiscal 2008
</B>
	&rdquo;) in
	comparison with those as at and for the financial year of the Company ended
	December 31, 2007 (&ldquo;
<B>
	fiscal 2007
</B>
	&rdquo;), as well as future
	prospects of the Company. This MD&amp;A should be read in conjunction with the
	audited consolidated financial statements of the Company for fiscal 2008 and
	fiscal 2007. As the Company&rsquo;s consolidated financial statements are
	prepared in United States dollars, all dollar amounts in this MD&amp;A are
	expressed in United States dollars unless otherwise specified. Additional
	information relating to the Company, including the Company&rsquo;s annual
	information form, is available on SEDAR at www.sedar.com and on EDGAR at
	www.sec.gov.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
<B>
	Forward-Looking Statements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The following MD&amp;A contains forward-looking statements. All statements, other than statements of historical fact, that address activities, events or developments that the Company believes, expects or anticipates will or may occur in the future (including, without limitation, statements regarding estimates and/or assumptions in respect of capital costs, mineral resource and mineral reserve
	estimates, potential mineralization, exploration results and future plans and objectives of the Company) are forward-looking statements. These forward-looking statements reflect the current expectations or beliefs of the Company based on information currently available to the Company. Forward-looking statements are subject to a number of risks and uncertainties that may cause the actual results of the Company to differ materially from those discussed in the forward-looking statements,
	and even if such actual results are realized or substantially realized, there can be no assurance that they will have the expected consequences to, or effects on the Company. Factors that could cause actual results or events to differ materially from current expectations include, among other things, uncertainties relating to the availability and costs of financing needed in the future, uncertainty of estimates of capital and operating costs, production estimates and estimated economic
	return, the possibility that actual circumstances will differ from the estimates and assumptions used in the economic studies of the Company&rsquo;s projects, failure to establish estimated mineral resources or mineral reserves (the Company&rsquo;s mineral resource and mineral reserve figures are estimates and no assurances can be given that the indicated levels of gold will be produced), the possibility that future exploration results will not be consistent with the Company&rsquo;s
	expectations, changes in world gold markets and equity markets, political developments in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (the &ldquo;
</FONT>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	DRC
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	&rdquo;), fluctuations in currency exchange rates, inflation, changes to regulations affecting the Company&rsquo;s activities, the uncertainties involved in interpreting drilling results and other geological data and the other risks involved in the gold exploration and
	development industry. Any forward-looking statement speaks only as of the date on which it is made and, except as may be required by applicable securities laws, the Company disclaims any intent or obligation to update any forward-looking statement, whether as a result of new information, future events or results or otherwise. Although the Company believes that the assumptions inherent in the forward-looking statements are reasonable, forward-looking statements are not guarantees of
	future performance and accordingly undue reliance should not be put on such statements due to the inherent uncertainty therein.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE FOOTER">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<A NAME="BANRO40F_12312008_HTM_PAGENUM">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	1
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX; FONT-SIZE: 1PT" TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" SIZE="2" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage70"></A>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2">
<B>
	General
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The Company is engaged in the acquisition and exploration of gold properties. The Company&rsquo;s main exploration focus is in the South Kivu and Maniema Provinces of the DRC where the Company holds, through four wholly-owned DRC subsidiaries, a 100% interest in four gold projects, Twangiza, Namoya, Lugushwa and Kamituga. As well, the Company&rsquo;s wholly-owned DRC subsidiary, Banro Congo Mining SARL,
	holds title to 14 exploration permits (the &ldquo;
<B>
	Banro Congo PRs
</B>
	&rdquo;) covering ground located between and contiguous to the Company&rsquo;s Twangiza, Kamituga and Lugushwa projects, covering an area of 2,711 square kilometers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	During fiscal 2008 and up to the date of this MD&amp;A, the Company continued its exploration activities at Twangiza, Namoya and Lugushwa. Exploration activities at all three projects consisted of core drilling as well as gridding, soil sampling, trenching and rock sampling and geological mapping. The Company has to date completed the planned pre-feasibility drilling program at Namoya as well
	as the full feasibility drilling program at Twangiza. With the completion of the two drilling programs, the Company has postponed all drilling activities and is focusing its exploration efforts on the delineation of several new mineral prospects which have been identified at its Twangiza, Lugushwa and Namoya projects and within its 14 exploration permit areas. This low-cost exploration program consists of gridding, mapping, and soil, stream and rock sampling. These new targets were
	identified through the LIDAR, airborne magnetic and radiometric surveys completed in 2007 and 2008. The Company has completed the feasibility study of the Twangiza project and is focusing on the completion of the pre-feasibility study of the Namoya project.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	There are currently significant uncertainties regarding commodities prices, including the price of gold, and the availability of equity financing for the purposes of mineral exploration and development. Over the past several months commodity prices have significantly dropped and financial markets have deteriorated to the extent that it has become extremely difficult to raise new capital. It
	is expected that current financial market conditions are likely to remain volatile for fiscal 2009 and probably until fiscal 2010 due to the weakening global economy and slower economic growth prospects. As a result, the Company may have difficulties raising equity financing for the purposes of exploration and project development without further diluting present shareholders of the Company. In response to continuing deterioration of global economic conditions and problems in the credit
	markets, the Company is scaling back its operations by postponing drilling activities as noted above and implementing cost-saving measures in every area of its business in order to meet near-term challenges while working on long term strategies for project development, including strategic partnerships. The Company believes that the Twangiza&ndash;Namoya gold belt, where the Company&rsquo;s projects are located, is one of the largest undeveloped gold districts in Africa with a
	substantial resource base and tremendous exploration potentials.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	On September 17, 2008, the Company completed a financing involving the issuance of 11,000,000 units of the Company at a price of $1.75 per unit for gross proceeds of $19,250,000. Each unit consisted of one common share and one half of one common share purchase warrant. Each whole warrant (a &ldquo;
</FONT>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Warrant
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	&rdquo;)
	entitles the holder to purchase one common share of the Company for $2.20 until September 17, 2011. The underwriters who conducted the financing were RBC Capital Markets as lead manager, CIBC World Markets Inc., UBS Securities Canada Inc. and Raymond James Ltd. In addition, the Company granted to the underwriters an option, exercisable until October 17, 2008, to purchase up to an additional 1,000,000 common shares and 500,000 Warrants at a price of $1.75 per unit. This option was
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE FOOTER">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<A NAME="BANRO40F_12312008_HTM_PAGENUM">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	2
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX; FONT-SIZE: 1PT" TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" SIZE="2" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage71"></A>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	exercised in full, resulting in the issuance of 1,000,000 common shares and 500,000 Warrants of the Company on September 26, 2008 for gross proceeds of $1,750,000.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	On February 19, 2009, the Company announced that it had closed the issuance and sale of 10,000,000 common shares of the Company at a price of $1.40 per share for gross proceeds of $14,000,000 (the &ldquo;Offering&rdquo;). The Offering, which was non-brokered, was made under a second prospectus supplement (the &ldquo;Prospectus Supplement&rdquo;) to the Company&rsquo;s base shelf prospectus
	dated September 11, 2008 (the &ldquo;Shelf Prospectus&rdquo;). The Company has filed the Shelf Prospectus and the Prospectus Supplement with certain Canadian securities regulatory authorities. The Company has also filed a registration statement (which includes the Shelf Prospectus) and the Prospectus Supplement with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (the &ldquo;SEC&rdquo;). These documents and other documents filed by the Company and referred to therein are available
	on the SEC website at www.sec.gov and on SEDAR at www.sedar.com.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	In February 2009, the Company announced that following discussions it has received official confirmation from the DRC government that all aspects of the Company&rsquo;s Mining Convention and its mining licenses respecting the Company&rsquo;s projects in the DRC are in accordance with Congolese law.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Twangiza Project
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	During 2008, the Company drilled 132 core holes totaling 27,284 metres of drilling at the Twangiza project. Drilling was focused on the Twangiza Main and Twangiza North deposits. In total, the Company has completed 323 core holes totaling 70,733 metres of drilling at Twangiza during the last three fiscal years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	In January 2008, the Company announced updated mineral resource estimates for the Twangiza project.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	In April, May, July and October of 2008, the Company announced further results from the in-fill drilling program at Twangiza.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	In July 2008, the Company announced the results of the pre-feasibility study of the Twangiza project. The pre-feasibility study was prepared by a number of independent consulting companies, including SRK Consulting, Cardiff (mineral reserve/resource), SRK Consulting, Johannesburg (mining, environmental and social), SGS Lakefield, Johannesburg (metallurgical testwork), Knight Pi&eacute;sold
	Ltd., Vancouver (power), AMEC, UK (tailings dam) and SENET, Johannesburg (processing and infrastructure). SENET also undertook the pre-feasibility economic valuation and report compilation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	In January 2009, the Company announced updated independent mineral resource estimates for the Twangiza project. SRK Consulting (UK) Limited (&ldquo;
</FONT>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	SRK (UK)
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	&rdquo;) prepared these estimates for Twangiza, which are set out in Table I below. Martin Pittuck, C.Eng, who is an employee of SRK (UK), was the
	&ldquo;qualified person&rdquo; (as such term is defined in National Instrument 43-101) for the purpose of these estimates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV TITLE="EE+ PAGE FOOTER">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<A NAME="BANRO40F_12312008_HTM_PAGENUM">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	3
</FONT>
</A>
</P>

	&nbsp;
