<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.7IN">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="ARIAL">
	Banro Corporation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: -0.92IN; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.92IN">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	(Expressed in U.S. dollars)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_33"></A>
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	December 31, 2008, 2007 and 2006
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="216">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Nature of Business
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Banro Corporation&rsquo;s (the &ldquo;Company&rdquo;) business focus is the exploration of mineral properties in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (the &ldquo;Congo&rdquo;). The Company was continued under the
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Canada Business Corporations Act
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	on April 2,
	2004. The Company was previously governed by the Ontario
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Business Corporations Act.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.25IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	These consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with Canadian generally accepted accounting principles applicable to a going concern, which assumes that the Company will continue in operation for a reasonable period of time and will be able to realize its assets and discharge its liabilities in the normal course of operations. The Company has
	not generated revenues from operations. As such, the Company&rsquo;s ability to continue as a going concern depends on its ability to successfully raise additional financing. Although the Company has been successful in the past in obtaining financing and subsequently raised financing (Note 16), there is no assurance that it will be able to obtain adequate financing in the future or that such financing will be available on acceptable terms.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="216">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Principles of Consolidation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	These consolidated financial statements include the accounts of the Company, its wholly-owned subsidiary in the United States, Banro American Resources Inc., and its wholly-owned subsidiaries in the Congo, Banro Congo Mining SARL, Kamituga Mining SARL, Lugushwa Mining SARL, Namoya Mining SARL and Twangiza Mining SARL. All inter-company
	transactions and balances have been eliminated on consolidation.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: -2.25IN; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_34"></A>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="216">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Investments
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Investments in companies subject to significant influence are accounted for using the equity method. Investments in companies where significant influence cannot be exerted are designated as available-for-sale. See Financial Instruments &ndash; recognition and measurement for further discussion.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: -2.25IN; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="216">

<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Property, Plant and Equipment
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Property, plant and equipment is recorded at cost less accumulated amortization. Amortization is recorded as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

	&nbsp;

<HR ALIGN="CENTER" SIZE="2" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage94"></A>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.7IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 3PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.7IN">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="ARIAL">
	Banro Corporation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: -0.92IN; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.92IN">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	(Expressed in U.S. dollars)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_35"></A>
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	December 31, 2008, 2007 and 2006
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="216">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Asset Impairment
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The Company monitors events and changes in circumstances which may require an assessment of the recoverability of its long lived assets. If required, the Company would assess recoverability using estimated undiscounted future operating cash flows. If the carrying amount of an asset is not recoverable, an impairment loss is recognized in
	operations, measured by comparing the carrying amount of the asset to its fair value. No impairment losses were warranted or recorded for the years ended December 31, 2008 and 2007.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: -2.25IN; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="216">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Foreign Currency Translation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	These consolidated financial statements are expressed in the functional currency of the Company, United States dollars (&ldquo;U.S.$&rdquo;). The Company&rsquo;s foreign operations are all considered integrated operations and are translated as follows: monetary assets and liabilities are translated at the spot rates of exchange in effect
	at the end of the year; non-monetary items are translated at historical exchange rates in effect on the dates of the transactions. Revenues and expense items are translated at average rates of exchange in effect during the year, except for amortization which is translated at its corresponding historical rate. Realized exchange gains and losses are included in the consolidated statements of operations and other comprehensive loss.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: -2.25IN; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_36"></A>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Deferred Exploration
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="216">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Expenditures
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Exploration costs relating to mineral properties and rights are deferred and carried as an asset until the results of the projects are known. As the Company currently has no operational income, any incidental revenues earned in connection with these properties or related exploration activities are applied as a reduction to capitalized
	exploration costs. If a property is determined to be non-commercial, non- productive or its value is impaired, those costs in excess of estimated recoveries are written off to operations.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="216">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Stock Options
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The Company has a stock option plan, which is described in Note 6(d). The Company uses the fair value method of accounting for stock options granted to directors, officers and employees whereby the fair value of options granted is recorded as a compensation expense in the financial statements. Compensation expense on stock options
	granted to non-employees is measured at the earlier of the completion of performance and the date the options are vested using the fair value method and is recorded as an expense in the same period as if the Company had paid cash for the goods or services received. Any consideration paid by directors, officers, employees and consultants on exercise of stock options or purchase of shares is credited to share capital. Shares are issued from treasury upon the exercise
	of stock options.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: -2.25IN; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- MARKER FORMAT-SHEET="PARA DEFAULT" FSL="DEFAULT" -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	9
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.7IN">

<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="ARIAL">
	Banro Corporation

<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	December 31, 2008, 2007 and 2006

	&nbsp;

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="216">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Asset Retirement Obligations
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The fair value of the liability of an asset retirement obligation is recorded when it is incurred and the corresponding increase to the asset is depreciated over the life of the asset. The liability is increased over time to reflect an accretion element considered in the initial measurement at fair value. The Company has no asset
	retirement obligations recorded on its balance sheet as at December 31, 2008 and 2007.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Financial Instruments &ndash; recognition
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: -2.25IN; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.25IN">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	and measurement
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.25IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Held-for-trading financial instruments which include cash and cash equivalents are initially measured at fair value and changes in fair value are recognized in net income for the period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.25IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Loans and receivables, held-to-maturity financial instruments and other financial liabilities are initially measured at fair value and subsequently measured at amortized cost. Gains or losses resulting from revaluation and impairment write-downs are recognized in net income for the period. The Company&rsquo;s short term investments are classified as held-to maturity.
	Accounts receivable are classified as loans and receivables while accounts payable are classified as other financial liabilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.25IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Available-for-sale financial assets, which include the Company&rsquo;s investment in BRC DiamondCore Ltd., are recorded at fair value, with unrealized changes in fair value recorded in other comprehensive income (loss) except for losses in value that are considered other than temporary. Impairment losses that are considered other than temporary were recorded in the
	statement of operations in the year the impairment occurs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: -2.25IN; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_37"></A>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="216">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Income Taxes
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The asset and liability method is used to determine income taxes. Pursuant to this method, future tax assets and liabilities are recognized for future tax consequences attributable to differences between financial statement carrying values and tax bases of assets and liabilities. Future tax assets and liabilities are measured using
	substantially enacted tax rates expected to be recovered or settled. The effect on future tax assets and liabilities of a change in tax rate is recognized in income in the period that includes the substantive enactment date. Net future income tax assets are offset by valuation allowances to the extent that they are not more likely not to be realized.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: -0.92IN; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.92IN">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	(Expressed in U.S. dollars)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_38"></A>
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	December 31, 2008, 2007 and 2006
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="216">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Loss per Share
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Loss per share calculations are based on the weighted average number of common shares and common share equivalents issued and outstanding during the year. Diluted earnings per share is calculated using the treasury method. The treasury method, which assumes that outstanding stock options with an average exercise price below market price
	of the underlying shares are exercised and the assumed proceeds are used to repurchase common shares of the Company at the average market price of the common shares for the period.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="216">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Use of Estimates
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	These consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with Canadian generally accepted accounting principles which require management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosures of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the consolidated
	financial statements and the reported amounts of revenue and expenses during the reporting period. Actual results could differ from those estimates. Significant estimates and assumptions include those related to the recoverability of deferred exploration expenditures and assessment of other than temporary declines in investments.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="216">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Variable Interest Entities
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Variable Interest Entities (&ldquo;VIE&rsquo;s&rdquo;) are consolidated by the Company when it is determined that it will, as the primary beneficiary, absorb the majority of the VIE&rsquo;s expected losses or expected residual returns. The Company currently does not have any VIE&rsquo;s.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.49IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Future Accounting Standards
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.25IN">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	International Financial Reporting Standards (&ldquo;IFRS&rdquo;)
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.25IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	In February 2008, the Accounting Standards Board (&ldquo;AcSB&rdquo;) of the Canadian Institute of Chartered Accountants (&ldquo;CICA&rdquo;) confirmed that Canadian Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (&ldquo;Canadian GAAP&rdquo;) for publicly accountable enterprises will be converged with International Financial Reporting Standards (&ldquo;IFRS&rdquo;)
	effective in the calendar year 2011. The conversion to IFRS will be required, for the Company, for interim and annual financial statements beginning on January 1, 2011. IFRS uses a conceptual framework similar to Canadian GAAP, but there are significant differences on recognition, measurement and disclosures. In the period leading up to the conversion, the AcSB will continue to issue accounting standards that are converged with IFRS such as IAS 2 &ldquo;Inventories&rdquo; and IAS 38
	&ldquo;Intangible Assets&rdquo;, thus mitigating the impact of adopting IFRS at the mandatory transition date. The Company will monitor changes arising from this convergence and as required by CSA Staff Notice 52-320.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<BR>
<!-- MARKER FORMAT-SHEET="PARA DEFAULT" FSL="DEFAULT" -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	11
</FONT>
</P>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 1PX; FONT-SIZE: 1PT" TITLE="EE+ PAGE BREAK">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" SIZE="2" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage97"></A>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.7IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 3PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.7IN">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="ARIAL">
	Banro Corporation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: -0.92IN; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.92IN">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	(Expressed in U.S. dollars)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	December 31, 2008, 2007 and 2006
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 2.25IN; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Goodwill and intangible assets
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.25IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	In February 2008, the CICA issued accounting standard Section 3064,
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Goodwill and intangible assets,
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	replacing Section 3062
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Goodwill and intangible assets
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	and Section 3450,
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Research and development costs.
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Section 3064 establishes standards for the recognition, measurement, presentation and disclosure of goodwill subsequent to its initial recognition and of intangible assets by profit-oriented enterprises. Standards concerning goodwill are unchanged from the standards included in the previous Section 3062. Section 3064 will be applicable to financial statements relating to
	fiscal years beginning on or after October 1, 2008. The Company does not anticipate the adoption of this standard to have a significant impact on its consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Accounting Changes
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 2.25IN; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Capital Disclosures
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.25IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	In February 2007, the CICA issued accounting standard Section 1535,
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Capital Disclosures
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	which is effective for fiscal years beginning on or after October 1, 2007
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	.
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Section 1535 requires disclosure of information that
	enables users of its financial statements to evaluate the entity&rsquo;s objectives, policies and processes for managing capital. The Company adopted this standard commencing in the 2008 fiscal year. See Note 14 for additional details.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 2.25IN; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Financial Instruments &ndash; Disclosure and Presentation
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 2.25IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	In February 2007, the CICA issued accounting standards Section 3862,
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Financial Instruments &ndash; Disclosure
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	and Section 3863,
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Financial Instruments &ndash; Presentation,
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	which are effective for fiscal years
	beginning on or after October 1, 2007. Section 3862 requires financial statement disclosure to enable users to evaluate the significance of financial instruments for the Company&rsquo;s financial position and performance and the nature and extent of risks arising from financial instruments that the Company is exposed to during the reporting period and at the balance sheet date and how the Company is managing those risks. Also, Section 3863&rsquo;s purpose is to enhance the financial
	statement&rsquo;s users understanding of the significance of the financial instruments to the Company&rsquo;s financial position, performance and cash flows. The Company adopted this standard in the 2008 fiscal year. See Note 13 for additional details.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.35IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- MARKER FORMAT-SHEET="PARA DEFAULT" FSL="DEFAULT" -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	12

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="24">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	1.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Interest in Congolese Subsidiaries
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.25IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The Company operates primarily in one operating segment and its assets located in the Congo, including its interests in gold properties, may be subject to sovereign risks, including political and economic instability, government regulations relating to mining, military repression, civil disorder, currency fluctuations and inflation, all or any of which may impede the
	Company&rsquo;s activities in this country or may result in the impairment or loss of part or all of the Company&rsquo;s interest in the properties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="24">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	2.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Short Term Investments
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.25IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The Company has invested in a Canadian dollar (&ldquo;Cdn$&rdquo;) discount note with an interest rate of 1.59%, maturity of January 20, 2009 and a market value of $1,996,620 (Cdn$ 2,431,937) (2007 - $11,275,006, Cdn$11,176,652). In 2008, the Company had investments in U.S.$ commercial paper and discount notes of $nil (2007 - $18,486,429). An amount of $1,995,757
	(2007 - $3,049,500) outstanding in short-term investments has been reclassified to restricted cash in the balance sheet (see Note 12).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;

<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 3PT SOLID; HEIGHT: 0.1IN" VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="97">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	$ 3,507,960
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

</TABLE>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.24IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The Company owns 3,744,032 common shares, representing a 14.35% (December 31, 2007 &ndash; 27.43%) equity interest, in BRC DiamondCore Ltd. (&ldquo;BRC&rdquo;) with a quoted market value of $768,463 (December 31, 2007 - $26,438,856). In addition, an amount of $4,317 was payable to BRC with respect to the Company&rsquo;s share of common expenses in the Congo. The
	principal business of BRC is the acquisition and exploration of diamond properties. As at December 31, 2008, the Company recognized an unrealized loss of $13,247,753 to other comprehensive income to adjust the Company&rsquo;s investment in BRC to its fair market value of $768,463. During the fourth quarter of 2008, the global economic down-turn, the credit crisis and the lack of available financing in the market, collectively resulted in a significant decline in the price of many
	products and commodities, including rough diamonds. BRC as well as many junior mining companies, particularly in the diamond sector, were severely impacted by the decline in price of commodities which in turn resulted in a significant decline in their stock market values during 2008, including BRC&rsquo;s. As a result, the Company recorded an impairment loss of $13,247,753 and transferred the full unrealized loss from other comprehensive income to net loss to reflect an other than
	temporary decline in value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	13

	Banro Corporation

<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">

</FONT>
</B>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="24">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	3.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">

	Investments (continued)
</FONT>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="19">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: NORMAL; MARGIN-TOP: 10.05PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="29">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	(a)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Investment in BRC DiamondCore Ltd. (formerly BRC Diamond Corporation) (continued)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	On February 11, 2008, BRC completed the acquisition of all of the outstanding shares of Diamond Core Resources Limited (&ldquo;Diamond Core&rdquo;), a South African diamond exploration company. As the consideration for this acquisition, BRC issued to Diamond Core shareholders one common share of BRC for every 24.5 Diamond Core shares held (subject to the rounding of
	fractional shares), such that immediately following the completion of the acquisition, BRC had outstanding approximately 25.74 million shares and former Diamond Core shareholders held approximately 47% of BRC&rsquo;s outstanding shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	As a result of this transaction, the Company&rsquo;s equity interest in BRC was reduced to approximately 14.55% and a dilution gain of $11,363,090 was recorded. The Company no longer exercises significant influence over the operations of BRC and therefore has reclassified this equity investment as available-for-sale.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Prior to February 11, 2008, the assets and liabilities of BRC are translated into U.S. $ at the year end rate of exchange for the purpose of incorporation into the Company&rsquo;s consolidated financial statements, using the equity method. Accumulated exchange gains and losses arising from such translation are reported in the consolidated balance sheets under
	accumulated other comprehensive loss as a separate component of shareholders&rsquo; equity. As of December 31, 2007, the carrying value of the investment was $3,504,221. In addition, as at December 31, 2007, an amount of $3,739 was due from BRC with respect to the Company&rsquo;s share of common expenses in the Congo.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	In March 2007, BRC issued, by way of private placement, 1,000,000 of its common shares at a price of Cdn$5.00 per share for gross proceeds of Cdn$5,000,000. In addition, during 2007, BRC issued 227,600 common shares, on the exercise of broker warrants and stock options, for gross proceeds of Cdn$472,560. The Company did not participate in these financings and therefore
	its equity interest in BRC was reduced to 27.43%. This reduction in equity interest resulted in a dilution gain of $1,124,779.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	In March 2006, BRC issued, by way of private placement, 1,900,000 of its common shares at a price of Cdn$3.50 per share for gross proceeds of Cdn$6,650,000. In April 2006, BRC issued 60,000 common shares, on the exercise of broker warrants, at a price of Cdn$2.50 per share for gross proceeds of Cdn$150,000. The Company did not participate in these financings and
	therefore its equity interest in BRC was reduced to 30.14%. This reduction in equity interest resulted in a dilution gain of $1,514,962.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The Company&rsquo;s investment in BRC is summarized as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="24">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 111.24%; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="24">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 91.8%; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	(b)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 91.8%; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Investment in Loncor Resources Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	As at December 31, 2006, the Company owned 2,584,300 common shares, representing a 48.76% equity interest in Loncor Resources Inc. (&ldquo;Loncor&rdquo;), a mineral exploration company. On December 21, 2007, the Company sold back to Loncor all of its common shares of Loncor at fair value of Cdn$258,430. The Company received all amounts due from Loncor in the amount of
	$ 413,156.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	On March 30, 2006, the Board of Directors of the Company approved the issue of common shares of the then wholly-owned subsidiary, Loncor, to an officer and director of the Company for cash consideration of Cdn$271,570. This resulted in the Company&rsquo;s equity interest in Loncor being reduced from 100% to 48.76% and the Company no longer controlling this entity. As
	the Company continued to exercise significant influence over Loncor&rsquo;s operations until its disposal in the current year, it changed the method of accounting for its investment in Loncor from the consolidation method to the equity method.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- MARKER FORMAT-SHEET="PARA DEFAULT" FSL="DEFAULT" -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	15
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="24">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	3.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">

	Investments (continued)

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="24">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	(c)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Investment in Nevada Bob&rsquo;s International Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	As at December 31, 2006, the investment in Nevada Bob&rsquo;s International Inc. (&ldquo;NBI&rdquo;), a licensor of certain golf equipment and apparel trademarks, represented 4.67% of the outstanding common shares of NBI and was accounted for under the cost method and was written down only when there was an other than temporary loss in value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	On January 1, 2007, the Company designated this investment as available-for-sale and was therefore re-valued at fair value of $160,013, resulting in the recognition of an unrealized loss on adoption of $18,825.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	During 2007, this investment was sold for $160,013 which resulted in a realized gain of $9,412 and moved out of accumulated other comprehensive loss.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

</FONT>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="24" NOWRAP>

	&nbsp;

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="24" NOWRAP>

	(a)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="167" NOWRAP>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 89.64%; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Unlimited number of common shares
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Unlimited number of preference shares, issuable in series
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-TOP: 12PT" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="24">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 108.54%; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-TOP: 12PT" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="24">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 89.64%; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	(b)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-TOP: 12PT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 89.64%; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Issued Share Capital - Common Shares
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	On September 17, 2008, the Company completed a financing involving the issuance of 11,000,000 units of the Company at a price of $1.75 per unit for gross proceeds of $19,250,000. Each unit consisted of one common share and one half of one common share purchase warrant. Each whole warrant (a &ldquo;Warrant&rdquo;) entitles the holder to purchase one common share of the
	Company for $2.20 until September 17, 2011. The underwriters who conducted the financing were RBC Capital Markets as lead manager, CIBC World Markets Inc., UBS Securities Canada Inc. and Raymond James Ltd. In addition, the Company granted to the underwriters an option, exercisable until October 17, 2008, to purchase up to an additional 1,000,000 common shares and 500,000 Warrants at a price of $1.75 per unit. This option was exercised in full, resulting in the issuance of 1,000,000
	common shares and 500,000 Warrants of the Company on September 26, 2008 for gross proceeds of $1,750,000.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	On May 4, 2006, the Company completed a financing involving the issuance of 3,925,000 common shares of the Company at a price of Cdn$12.80 per share for total gross proceeds of Cdn$50,240,000. The underwriters who conducted the financing were RBC Capital Markets as lead manager, Raymond James Ltd. and MGI Securities Inc. In addition, the Company granted to the
	underwriters an option, exercisable for a period of 30 days after the date of closing, to purchase up to 451,000 in additional common shares of the Company at a price of Cdn$12.80 per share. This option was exercised in full, resulting in the issuance of 451,000 common shares of the Company on May 15, 2006.
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="24">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 108.54%; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="24">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 89.64%; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	(c)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 89.64%; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Share Purchase Warrants
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	As at December 31, 2008, the Company had outstanding Warrants to purchase 6,000,000 common shares of the Company at a price of $2.20 per share until September 17, 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="24">

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	(d)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 89.64%; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Stock Options
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The Company has an incentive Stock Option Plan under which non-transferable options to purchase common shares of the Company may be granted to directors, officers, employees or service providers of the Company or any of its subsidiaries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Under this Stock Option Plan, for options granted prior to January 16, 2006, the options vest 25% immediately at grant date and 25% on each of the three consecutive six-month periods subsequent to the issuance. For options granted after January 16, 2006, 75% vest on the 12 month anniversary of their grant date and the remaining 25% of the options vest on the 18 month
	anniversary of their grant date. As at December 31, 2008, the Company had 3,524,750 stock options outstanding to acquire common shares at a weighted-average price of Cdn$9.74 per share, expiring at various dates between February 2009 and October 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	(d)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 89.64%; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Stock Options - (continued)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	During 2008, the Company recognized in the statement of operations as an expense $1,429,438 (2007 - $5,734,295; 2006 - $1,167,062) representing the fair value at the date of grant of stock options previously granted to employees, directors and officers under the Company&rsquo;s Stock Option Plan. The Company extended by one year to January 21, 2010, the expiry date of
	200,000 stock options previously granted to a director of the Company. These options were fully vested as of July 2005. An additional expense of $36,329 with respect to this modification of the terms of a stock option was calculated in accordance with CICA section 3870.55 and is included in the amount recognized in the statement of operations. The expense reflects the incremental fair value of the options calculated as the difference between the value of the modified options and the
	value of the old options immediately before their terms were modified. In addition, an amount of $495,203 (2007 &ndash; $3,446,115; 2006 - $2,076,385) related to stock options issued to employees of the Company&rsquo;s subsidiaries in the Congo was capitalised as deferred exploration expenditures. These amounts were credited accordingly to contributed surplus in the balance sheet.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The Black-Scholes option-pricing model was used to estimate values of all stock options granted during the year based on the following factors:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 0IN; PADDING-LEFT: 0IN; PADDING-RIGHT: 0IN; PADDING-TOP: 9.1PT" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="24" NOWRAP>

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	(i)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

	risk-free interest rate: 2.02% to 2.83% (2007 &ndash; 3.83% to 4.23%; 2006 &ndash; 3.83% to 4.08%)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="24">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 108.54%; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
	&nbsp;

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="24">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 89.64%; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	(d)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 89.64%; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Stock Options - (continued)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The total intrinsic value of options exercised in 2008, 2007 and 2006 was $2,596,828, $10,298,549 and $12,215,951, respectively. The aggregate intrinsic value of outstanding and exercisable stock options was negative at December 31, 2008 as the majority of stock options had an exercise price that was greater than their market value, except for 180,000 outstanding
	options which had an intrinsic value of $22,167.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The weighted-average-grant date fair value of stock options granted was Cdn$1.03, Cdn$5.17 and Cdn$6.33 as at December 31, 2008, 2007 and 2006, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The total fair value of shares vested during the years ended December 31, 2008, 2007, 2006 was $4,032,750, $8,692,493, and $843,140, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Cash received on exercise of stock options during the years ended December 31, 2008, 2007 and 2006 was $2,903,846, $5,302,495 and $4,387,552, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The number of outstanding options excluded from the diluted loss per share calculation as these would be anti-dilutive, for the years ending December 31, 2008, 2007 and 2006 was 3,524,750, 3,690,551 and 4,811,051, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	(e)

	Loss per share was calculated on the basis of the weighted average number of common shares outstanding for the year ended December 31, 2008, amounting to 43,770,280 (2007 &ndash; 39,678,835; 2006 &ndash; 36,760,302) common shares.
</FONT>

	Diluted loss per share has not been presented since the exercise of the stock options and Warrants would be anti-dilutive.

At December 31, 2008, $87,195 (2007 - $9,551; 2006 &ndash; $20,054) owing to this
	legal firm was included in accounts payable.

	$ 65,004,224

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	As at December 31, 2008, the Company had estimated net capital losses for Canadian tax purposes of $38,660,070. These losses do not expire and may be utilized to reduce future taxable capital gains, if any.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	As at December 31, 2008, the Company has estimated non-capital losses for Canadian income tax purpose that may be carried forward to reduce taxable income derived in future years. A summary of these tax losses is provided below. These tax losses will expire as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12.2PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.3IN">
	&nbsp;

<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_53"></A>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.4PT" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="586">
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE: AVOID">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="425">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 124.2%; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 72.8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.9IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.33IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	A valuation allowance has been recorded to offset the potential benefits of these carry-forward non-capital losses, capital losses and deductible temporary differences in these consolidated financial statements as the realization thereof is not considered more likely than not.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.33IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Banro&rsquo;s subsidiaries in the Congo have no taxable income and will benefit from a 10 year tax holiday from the date of commencement of production. Under U.S. GAAP, exploration expenditures are deducted from income; and they will be deductible for tax purposes in future periods. Based on the expected rate of 30%, the deferred tax assets of approximately
	$31,768,000, $19,226,000 and $10,240,000 for 2008, 2007 and 2006 respectively have been reduced to $nil by a corresponding valuation allowance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="24">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
<B>
	12.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
<B>
	Commitments and Guarantees
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.25IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	RBC Dominion Securities Inc. (the &ldquo;Lender&rdquo;) has provided BRC a Cdn$6,000,000 line of credit (the &ldquo;Facility&rdquo;). The Facility was first made available to BRC in October 2007 originally in the amount of Cdn$3,000,000 and subsequently increased to Cdn$6,000,000 in February 2008. The Company agreed to act as guarantor of the Facility. The said
	guarantee is secured by way of a pledge of the Company&rsquo;s investments with the Lender. In connection with the guarantee, the Company and BRC entered into an agreement dated as of October 29, 2007 pursuant to which BRC agreed to repay all amounts outstanding under the Facility and to terminate the Facility by July 28, 2008. BRC has not repaid all amounts outstanding under the Facility. There is currently outstanding under the Facility principal in the amount of Cdn$5,850,000
	(US$4,802,850) and accrued interest in the amount of Cdn$330,772 (US$271,564). BRC is responsible for making interest payments under the Facility. The Company has not assumed these obligations. Although BRC has advised the board of directors of the Company that BRC continues to actively seek to raise the capital and fully expects to repay the Facility, there can be no assurance that BRC will be able to repay the Facility. Until such time as BRC repays the Facility in full and the
	Facility is terminated, the Company will not be able to use the portion of the investments pledged to the Lender required to fully secure the Facility to fund the Company&rsquo;s operations. An amount of $5,074,414 (2007 - $3,049,500) with respect to this guarantee has been classified as restricted cash in the balance sheet. In addition, if BRC is unable to repay the Facility when requested by the Lender and the Company&rsquo;s guarantee is called, the Company will be obligated to
	pay the amount outstanding under the Facility, which will adversely affect the Company&rsquo;s liquidity and capital resources.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; BORDER-TOP: 0.1PT SOLID; PADDING-TOP: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="24">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	13.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Financial Instruments and Risk Management
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 16.3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.25IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Fair Value of Financial Instruments
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 16.3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.25IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The balance sheet carrying amounts for cash, accounts receivable, short-term investments, restricted cash and accounts payable approximate fair value due to their short-term nature. Due to the use of subjective judgments and uncertainties in the determination of fair values these values should not be interpreted as being realizable in an immediate settlement of the
	financial instruments.
</FONT>
</P>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="24">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	13.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Financial Instruments and Risk Management (continued
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<BR>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 16.3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.23IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Foreign Exchange Risk
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 16.3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.23IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Foreign exchange risk is the risk that a variation in exchange rates between the United States dollar and Canadian dollar or other foreign currencies will affect the Company&rsquo;s operations and financial results. A portion of the Company&rsquo;s transactions is denominated in Canadian dollars and in Congolese francs. The Company is also exposed to the impact of
	currency fluctuations on its monetary assets and liabilities. Significant foreign exchange gains or losses are reflected as a separate component of the consolidated statement of operations and other comprehensive loss. The Company does not use derivatives instruments to reduce its exposure to foreign currency risk.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.23IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The following table indicates the impact of foreign currency exchange risk on net working capital as at December 31, 2008. The table below also provides a sensitivity analysis of a 10 percent strengthening of the US dollar against foreign currencies as identified which would have increased (decreased) the Company&rsquo;s net loss by the amounts shown in the table
	below. A 10 percent weakening of the US dollar against the same foreign currencies would have had the equal but opposite effect as at December 31, 2008.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.23IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.23IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.23IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Credit Risk
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.23IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Financial instruments which are potentially subject to credit risk for the Company consist primarily of cash and short-term investments. Cash as well as short-term investments are maintained with several financial institutions of reputable credit and may be redeemed upon demand. It is therefore the Company&rsquo;s opinion that such credit risk is subject to normal
	industry risks and is considered minimal.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.23IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- MARKER FORMAT-SHEET="PARA DEFAULT" FSL="DEFAULT" -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT SIZE="2">
	26
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.23IN; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Credit Risk (continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.23IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The Company limits its exposure to credit risk on investments by investing only in securities rated R1 by credit rating agencies such as the DBRS (Dominion Bond Rating Service). Management continuously monitors the fair value of its investments to determine potential credit exposures.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.23IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Short-term excess cash is invested in R1 rated investments including money market funds, bankers&rsquo; acceptances and other highly rated short-term investment instruments. Any credit risk exposure on cash balances is considered negligible as the Company places deposits only with major established banks in the countries in which it carries operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.23IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The carrying amount of financial assets represents the maximum credit exposure. The Company&rsquo;s gross credit exposure at December 31, 2008 and December 31, 2007 is as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<BR>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.23IN; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Currency Risk
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.23IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The Company is exposed to currency risk on its financial assets and liabilities denominated on currencies other than the United States dollar. The Company incurs in Canada a significant amount of its operating costs in Canada in Canadian dollars.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.23IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Liquidity Risk
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.23IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Liquidity risk is the risk that the Company will not be able to meet its financial obligations as they become due. The Company ensures that there is sufficient cash to meet its liabilities when they are due. Temporary surplus funds of the Company are invested in short term investments. The Company arranges the portfolio so that securities mature approximately when
	funds are needed. The key to success in managing liquidity is the degree of certainty in the cash flow projections. If future cash flows are fairly uncertain, the liquidity risk increases.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.23IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	As discussed in note 12, the guarantee provided for BRC will have an impact on the Company&rsquo;s liquidity risk if BRC is unable to meet its obligations with the Lender.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.23IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	Mineral Property Risks
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.23IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The Company&rsquo;s operations in the Congo are exposed to various levels of political risk and uncertainties, including political and economic instability, government regulations relating to exploration and mining, military repression and civil disorder, all or any of which may have a material adverse impact on the Company&rsquo;s activities or may result in
	impairment or loss of part or all of the Company&rsquo;s assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- MARKER FORMAT-SHEET="PARA DEFAULT" FSL="DEFAULT" -->

<B>
	Capital Management
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

</TABLE>

<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.25IN">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="ARIAL">
	The Company manages its cash, common shares, Warrants and stock options as capital. The Company&rsquo;s policy is to maintain sufficient capital base in order to meet its short term obligations and at the same time preserve investors&rsquo; confidence required to sustain future development of the business. The Company has deliberately minimized the dilution of
	shareholder value to date by carefully controlling the issuance of shares and by attracting shareholders who understand the long term value of the business being developed. The Company intends to maintain this approach throughout the development stage of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
